poem:
Title: Afloat Over Frigid Fellows

Boats laboured by breath of desperation, 
adrift on eddies of citizen discord.
Shadows pollinating the bitter saline,
Onto the indignant eyes of Dover, silent.
Whispers of chaos breaking upon 
cliffs of crumbling compromise. 
Pigeons of policy, strangled by the promised sea,
England and France, stark mirage in the pupil's mirror.
A discourse lost in the channel's groan,
Over whose waters, place calls home.
prompt: You are the poet Sylvia Legris. You woke up this morning feeling contemplative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK does not cooperate sufficiently over small boat crossings, says French body The UK is not coordinating sufficiently with France to reduce the number of people crossing the Channel in small boats or providing enough detailed information, French state auditors have said. The cour des comptes, an independent French body that examines the use of public funds, has published a report on the efficiency of French policy on illegal migration, in which it said France". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: UK does not cooperate sufficiently over small boat crossings, says French body The UK is not coordinating sufficiently with France to reduce the number of people crossing the Channel in small boats or providing enough detailed information, French state auditors have said. The cour des comptes, an independent French body that examines the use of public funds, has published a report on the efficiency of French policy on illegal migration, in which it said France
